alert.note: Alert for Warren (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 3:41PM EST until January 10 at 10:30PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northern and northwest Virginia, including the following counties, in northern Virginia, Culpeper and Fauquier. In northwest Virginia, Rappahannock and Warren. * WHEN...Until 1145 PM EST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 341 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated a broad area of heavy rainfall. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Culpeper... Warrenton... Bealeton... Sperryville... The Plains... Hume... Delaplane... New Baltimore... Marshall... Nokesville... Chester Gap... Opal... Remington... Catlett... Calverton... Midland... Flint Hill... Washington... Jeffersonton... Turnbull... - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
